title: Poster, 1966–67
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed: Lower right: Entwurf: A. Hofmann/ Druck: Wassermann A.G.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Against a solid black background two rectangles form a "T" shape. The stem is white with red lettrs which spell 1966/67/ Stadttheater / Basel with a left justification. The upper portion of the "T" is comprised of a tripart black and white photographic montage with a closeup of the backstage theater lights at left; in the center, a composite image of graphic symbols including a dollar sign, an ace of hearts and a star, are superimposed on a musical staff; and at right a vertical pattern of ropes and cables.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, 1966–67.
1966–67. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-145.
